references.paper_title: Amp: adversarial motion priors for stylized physics-based character control
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant as it introduces adversarial motion priors for physics-based character control, which is a related technique to sim-to-real transfer and shares similar challenges in handling complex dynamics and uncertainties.

references.paper_title: Sim-to-real transfer of robotic control with dynamics randomization
references.reason: This paper is foundational as it introduces domain randomization (DR), a widely used sim-to-real technique, and the authors provide insights into the challenges and limitations of sim-to-real transfer, laying groundwork for future research.

references.paper_title: Domain randomization for transferring deep neural networks from simulation to the real world
references.reason: This paper is important as it applies DR to deep neural networks, a significant advancement from previous sim-to-real approaches, and provides a comprehensive analysis of DR for sim-to-real transfer.
This paper is highly relevant to the sim-to-real problem due to its focus on complex manipulation tasks that often involve significant reality gaps between simulations and the real world.
This paper is crucial as GANs are a core component of the proposed EASI method, offering a powerful framework for generating realistic data and distinguishing between simulated and real-world data.
